Breeding male.description: Male Red-breasted Mergansers have a cinnamon breast while male Common Mergansers have a white breast. Males also have grayish (not white) sides.

Female/nonbreeding male.description: Females/nonbreeding male Red-breasted Mergansers have less white on the chest than female Common Mergansers. They also do not have a white spot below the bill that is visible on female/nonbreeding male Common Mergansers.

Adult male.description: Hooded Mergansers are smaller than Common Mergansers with a shorter black bill. Males have a large white patch on the head that Common Mergansers lack.

Nonbreeding male.description: Female/nonbreeding male Hooded Mergansers are smaller and browner than Common Mergansers with darker bills and shaggier crests.

Female.description: Common Goldeneyes are smaller than Common Merganser with a shorter and wider bill. Females lack the female Common Merganser's shaggy crest.
Barrow's Goldeneyes are smaller than Common Merganser with a shorter and wider bill. They also have a yellow eye, whereas female Common Mergansers have a dark eye.
